title:          "The Hands-On XBee Lab Manual"
date:           2012-04-11T15:57:11.000Z
author:         Amit Naran
tags:           textbook, xbee
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/The-Hands-On-XBee-Lab-Manual/
---

<p>
  For developers interested in RF development <span><span class=
  "authortext"><a href="/users/microguy/"><img alt="" class="icon"
  src=
  "data:image/jpeg;base64,">
  </a> <a href="/users/microguy/">Jon Titus</a></span></span> has
  written a new textbook on using <a href=
  "http://www.digi.com/xbee/" rel="nofollow">XBee</a> modules for
  wireless communication.
</p>
<p>
  Jon has provided a brief introduction to the book and the topics
  covered.
</p>
<p>
  <img height="200|" width="200" alt="Xbee Textbook" src=
  "https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/anaran/200xNx_scaled_51kmn32vdil._sl500_aa300_.jpg.pagespeed.ic.zEiMf2l1mB.jpg"
  title="Xbee Textbook">
</p>
<p>
  <br>
</p>
<div class="flashbox fquote">
  <h4 class="ftitle">
    <span class="authortext"><a href="/users/microguy/"><img alt=""
    class="icon" src=
    "data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a>
    <a href="/users/microguy/">Jon Titus</a></span> wrote:
  </h4>
  <p>
    Many people want to use the XBee wireless modules, so I have
    written a new book, "The Hands-On XBee Lab Manual," which will
    appear in print from Newnes in May 2012. Amazon already has the
    book listed (ISBN: 978-0123914040) and the price is about $42.
  </p>
  <p>
    <br>
    When I tried to use the Digi XBee modules (not ZigBee, just
    IEEE 802.15.4) I found the Digi manual provided a lot of
    information, but it lacked practical information that showed
    how to use the modules and what they could do. My book includes
    22 hands-on experiments that start with an introduction to the
    X-CTU configuration software through node discovery and setting
    up a small network. The experiments show how to communicate
    analog and digital information, how to use commands for remote
    control, and how to transmit API commands and how to decode
    received information to decode analog and digital settings and
    information from remote modules. I also cover sleep modes, PWM
    outputs, and a few other topics.
  </p>
  <p>
    <br>
    Experiments that require an MCU provide code for an ARM mbed
    and an Arduino Uno module. The Newnes site will provide a
    download file that includes all the software and the X-CTU
    configuration files for the XBee modules. Each chapter includes
    that information in the text, too.
  </p>
  <p>
    Here's the link to the <a href=
    "http://www.amazon.com/Hands-XBEE-Lab-Manual-Communications/dp/0123914043"
    rel="nofollow">Amazon page</a>
  </p>
</div>
<p>
  Look forward to reading the text when it is released, it should
  be a great guide to development with Xbee modules.<br>
</p>
